quotation.p: We have privative words of every sort: / Aphonia. Aphemia. Aphasia. / Alexia. Apraxia. Agnosia. / Amnesia. Ataxia.
quotation.source: The Man Who Mistook His Wife for a Hat, music Michael Nyman, libretto Christopher Rawlence

quotation.p: Calm before the storm. Form is emptiness. Emptiness form.
quotation.source: The Man Who Mistook His Wife for a Hat, music Michael Nyman, libretto Christopher Rawlence

quotation.p: But what of the parietal regions, / The fibres, nerves, neurons, / The synapses of occipital zones? / What of the cytoarchitectonic, / The structure of visual processing?
quotation.source: The Man Who Mistook His Wife for a Hat, music Michael Nyman, libretto Christopher Rawlence

quotation.p: Does he see people / Or simply schematic / Cued memories?
quotation.source: The Man Who Mistook His Wife for a Hat, music Michael Nyman, libretto Christopher Rawlence

quotation.p: He dwells within schema; / He's lost touch with the concrete world.
quotation.source: The Man Who Mistook His Wife for a Hat, music Michael Nyman, libretto Christopher Rawlence

quotation.p: Olfactory algebra. / Mathematical odours. / Whiffs of the infinite rose. / Heaven in a wild flower.
quotation.source: The Man Who Mistook His Wife for a Hat, music Michael Nyman, libretto Christopher Rawlence

quotation.p: "Please. Where is the butter, that I might spread it lavishly and feel its oily smoothness?"
"Ain't got none, there's a plague on."
quotation.source: Greek, music Mark-Anthony Turnage, libretto Steven Berkoff

quotation.p: Open are the double doors of the horizon / Unlocked are its bolts / Clouds darken the sky / The stars rain down / The constellations stagger / The bones of the hell hounds tremble.
quotation.source: Akhnaten, music Philip Glass, libretto Shalom Goldman

quotation.p: Immediately I know that I've been sucked into hell and I can't get out. So anything that Adam Sandler is in, I just can't help it.

When he stood up, his face white and dirty and the silk of his breeches opened from waist to knee, it was the dirtiness of the rented breeches, the dirtiness of his slit underwear, and the clean, clean, unbearably clean whiteness of the thigh bone that I had seen, and it was that which was important.
quotation.author: Ernest Hemingway

quotation.p: "Oh, God, Mulder. It smells like... I think it's bile."
"Is there any way I can get it off my fingers quickly without betraying my cool exterior?"
quotation.source: Scully and Mulder, in the X-Files episode "Squeeze"

quotation.p: I confidently expect it to be a fairly resounding failure.
quotation.source: John Cleese, on the Monty Python reunion planned for 1999

quotation.p: My nose shall never be touched while heaven give me strength.
quotation.author: Sterne

quotation.p: All right. Have it your own way. Road to hell paved with unbought stuffed dogs. Not my fault.
quotation.author: Ernest Hemingway

quotation.p: Thank you for letting me borrow your objects.
Apparently, to implement this ominous mess, two committees have been "impaneled". At first glance, I read this as "impaled" (wishful thinking).
quotation.author: Stan Kelly-Bootle

quotation.p: What on earth is less likely than two committees to produce a seamless web of anything but intrigue and deficit? Who said "three committees"?
quotation.author: Stan Kelly-Bootle

quotation.p: run-time. n. (QA testing) the moment when the programmer shouts "Must run!" and disappears.
quotation.author: Stan Kelly-Bootle

quotation.p: prompt. n. (Unix) A symbol on the screen indicating which shell is attacking you.
quotation.author: Stan Kelly-Bootle

quotation.p: mnemonic. n. I had a wildly funny definition of this, but...oh, it may come back...
quotation.author: Stan Kelly-Bootle

quotation.p: BLOB. n. Acronym for Binary Large Object. Codd'n'Date's sci-fi nightmare in which huge unstructured thingies attack the relational integrity of all we love.
quotation.author: Stan Kelly-Bootle

quotation.p: As to why the outer planets wobble, it's 'cause they're so far away that nobody loves them, and they've been drinking.
The Answers to these Frequently Asked Questions have been verified by Encyclopedia Britannica. They have not, however, been verified to be correct.
Q. Does Kibo believe in furniture?
A. No. Go away, furniture!
Q. How did Kibo acquire this much power?
A. He invented the smiley.
Q. What does Kibo think of television?
A. TV is evil and must be destroyed. A good way to do this is to watch your set until it burns out.
Q. Don't you care?
A. Of course Kibo cares. Just not very much.
"Of course, just because we've heard a spine-chilling, blood-curdling scream of the sort to make your very marrow freeze in your bones doesn't automatically mean there's anything wrong."
This isn't life in the fast lane, it's life in the oncoming traffic.

It looked like the sort of book described in library catalogues as "slightly foxed", although it would be more honest to admit that it looked as though it had been badgered, wolved and possibly beared as well.
Tourist, Rincewind decided, meant "idiot".
quotation.source: Terry Pratchett, The Colour of Magic

quotation.p: There comes a time when you look into the mirror and realize that what you see is all that you will ever be. Then you accept it, or you kill yourself. Or you stop looking into mirrors.
We are dreamers, shapers, singers, and makers. We study the mysteries of laser and circuit, crystal and scanner, holographic demons and invocations of equations. These are the tools we employ...
quotation.source: Elric, in Babylon 5: "The Geometry of Shadows"

quotation.p: So much has been lost, so much forgotten. So much pain, so much blood. And for what, I wonder? The past tempts us, the present confuses us, and the future frightens us. And our lives slip away, moment by moment, lost in that vast terrible inbetween. But there is still time to cease that one last fragile moment. To choose something better, to make a difference, as you say. And I intend to do just that.
quotation.source: The Centauri emperor, in Babylon 5: "The Coming of Shadows"

quotation.p: The war we fight is not against powers and principalities, it is against chaos and despair. Greater than the death of flesh is the death of hope. The death of dreams. Against this peril we can never surrender.
The future is all around us, waiting in moments of transition, to be born in moments of revelation. No one knows the shape of that future, or where it will take us.
UN-altered REPRODUCTION and DISSEMINATION of this IMPORTANT Information is ENCOURAGED.
For quite some time now, I've been an advocate of a sort of IQ test for people prior to allowing them onto the Internet. Apparently a similar test doesn't exist to become an attorney.
There are two kinds of large software systems: those that evolved from small systems and those that don't work.

p.pre: Traceback (innermost last): File "/home/akuchlin/fortune.py", line 78, in ? print get(sys.argv[1]) ValueError: No relevant quotation found

quotation.p: ... a man and two smart-aleck robots wisecrack their way through some of the most awful movies ever committed to celluloid. ... This show must be the work of genius, because garden-variety stupidity would never come up with anything like this.
quotation.source: Mystery Science Theatre 3000, described in the April 1999 issue of Sci-Fi Universe

quotation.p: It is estimated that the statistical breakdown of HappyNet will be thus: 1.0000% nonbozo.*, 90.0000% bozo.*, 9.0000% megabozo.*. (Computations courtesy of Bell Labs)
quotation.author: Kibo

quotation.p: You are being given your own HappyNet group. Its placement will depend on your answer to this simple question: ARE YOU A BOZO? (CHECK EXACTLY ONE) [] YES [] NO
quotation.author: Kibo

quotation.p: ..signature has giant ASCII graphic: Forced to read "War And Peace" at 110 baud on a Braille terminal after having fingers rubbed with sandpaper.
quotation.author: Kibo

quotation.p: Spelling "too" as "to", "it's" as "its", "lose" as "loose", "you're" as "your", or any of the following--"wierd", "Anti-Semetic", "senerio", or "masterbation": Forced to write out Webster's Ninth ten times.
quotation.author: Kibo

quotation.p: Sending a newgroup message without permission of Leader Kibo: Poster is forced to adopt twelve wacky sitcom children.
quotation.author: Kibo

quotation.p: Posting "Please send e-mail, since I don't read this group": Poster is rendered illiterate by a simple trepanation.
quotation.author: Kibo

quotation.p: Posting to aus.* from the USA: Poster is deported to Australia after having a "Kick Me, Mate" sign glued to their forehead.
quotation.author: Kibo

quotation.p: Posting an article with a malformed address so that mail bounces when people reply: Poster and/or their admin are sent back to kindergarten.
quotation.author: Kibo

quotation.p: Saying "Imminent death of the net predicted!": Imminent execution of poster predicted.
quotation.author: Kibo

quotation.p: Mentioning Star Trek outside of the Star Trek groups: "Star Trek: Deep Space Nine" is cancelled, and all tapes of the original series are burned. William Shatner will direct all future movies.
quotation.author: Kibo

quotation.p: The Sony Walkman will become obsolete thanks to the Sony rnman. The instructions will be on a separate device, the Sony manman.
quotation.author: Kibo

quotation.p: This looks likes the sort of thing which will get vectored by the Libertarian and the gullible (by no means disjoint sets!).
quotation.author: Seth Finkelstein

quotation.p: And I'd be a Libertarian, if they weren't all a bunch of tax-dodging professional whiners.
quotation.author: Berke Breathed
quotation.source: In an interview by The Onion

quotation.p: Hanging on to the silly as I sail toward my mid-40s is my current project. The middle-age temptation to get serious about everything is Satan's handiwork.
quotation.author: Berke Breathed
quotation.source: In an interview by The Onion

quotation.p: The Internet uses a form of time-sharing. It may not be as fast as you would like, but it's time sharing. Demons may work the same way.
Assuming that their minimum speed of travel is the speed of electricity, 186,000 miles per second, a single demon can trouble a large number of people in the course of a few minutes.
I'm willing to accept that someone might just have all the answers. However, I'm pretty sure he won't be posting them on a GeoCities page.
Let's face it, if you can take seriously the idea that porcine pasty- white American redneck bigots are God's chosen people, you obviously can't have much of a sense of humor.

Missy and Beethoven are first smitten with each other while Dolly Parton and James Ingram sing "The Day I Fall in Love", and I'm telling you, there wasn't a dry face on the screen, mostly because the dogs were licking each other.

I guess you could laugh at this. You would have to be seriously alienated from normal human values and be nursing a deep-seated anger against movies that make you think even a little, but you could laugh.
quotation.source: Roger Ebert, reviewing The Big Hit

quotation.p: Not one single event in the entire plot can possibly take place unless every character in the cast has brains made of Bac-O-Bits.
There is a movie called Fargo. It is a masterpiece. Go see it. If you under any circumstances see Little Indian, Big City, I will never let you read one of my reviews again.
quotation.source: Roger Ebert, reviewing Little Indian, Big City

quotation.p: Mad Dog Time is the first movie I have seen that does not improve on the sight of a blank screen viewed for the same length of time.
quotation.source: Roger Ebert, reviewing Mad Dog Time

quotation.p: Giocante has been billed as "the new Bardot", and she's off to a good start: Bardot didn't make many good films, either.
quotation.source: Roger Ebert, reviewing Marie Baie Des Anges

quotation.p: One goes to this movie in the same spirit one visits an ancient town buried by lava centuries ago. To try to determine by examining the ruins what made the gods punish man so.
quotation.source: Roger Ebert, reviewing A Place for Lovers

quotation.p: Even if I buy the wretched Drum as a Moral Symbol, I'm still stuck with the kid as a pious little bastard.
quotation.source: Roger Ebert, reviewing The Tin Drum

quotation.p: Through a tortuous series of contrived misunderstandings, the boy and girl avoid happiness for most of the movie, although not as successfully as we do.
quotation.source: Roger Ebert, reviewing The Wedding Singer

quotation.p: I have often asked myself, "What would it look like if the characters in a movie were animatronic puppets created by aliens with an imperfect mastery of human behavior?" Now I know.
If I were more of a hero, I would spend the next couple of weeks breaking into theaters where this movie is being shown, and leading the audience to safety.
Now that I've inspired a character in a Godzilla movie, all I really still desire is for several Ingmar Bergman characters to sit in a circle and read my reviews to one another in hushed tones.
It's a movie without a brain in its three pretty little heads, which belong to Cameron Diaz, Drew Barrymore and Lucy Liu. This movie is a dead zone in their lives, and mine.
In all the annals of the movies, few films have been this odd, inexplicable and unpleasant.
quotation.author: Roger Ebert
quotation.source: In a review of "Death to Smoochy"
